data.message: New Year, new beginnings. Resolve to start 2014 with an exciting career opportunity – as one of our agents. http://bit.ly/X8P7sv

First of all, I'm a NYL agent going on my fourth year with the company.  I'm currently stranded down in Dallas, TX attending a meeting that we've had here for a couple of days (Leaders For Life).  The weather has been VERY unusual for the Big D!  With that said, most flights out have been cancelled until Saturday.  Secondly, the company has taken care of all arrangements for those of us here at our training center to accomodate those of us that can't go home tonight as scheduled.  Lastly, I would like to express my gratitude to New York Life Insurance Company for taking care of its agents.  This is truly a first class company from the top down!  New York Life takes care of its policyholders and their employees.  The slogan, Keep Good Going isn't just a catchy marketing phrase that the company has come up with, it's truly the company culture!  I mean that!  A big thank you!
Leave a comment & inspire others: This time of year, I am most grateful for _________. #KeepGoodGoing http://bit.ly/17jJMbI
Check out these holiday traditions from around the world. Now tell us, how does your family celebrate its heritage at the holidays? http://bit.ly/1dSjQH9
If you've resolved to save more money next year, here are 5 practical tips from MoneyNing. Inspire us & others! Share your own tips in the comments below. http://bit.ly/19jaoVR
Like & share if you agree: The greatest gift we can pass on to the next generation is love. #KeepGoodGoing http://bit.ly/1a5PNdl

I refuse to apologise.
I hate financial institutions and this was a great opportunity to besmirch one.
would do it again in a heartbeat.
How do you pay it forward during the holiday season? Check out these great ideas from Jessica at foundthemarbles.com. http://bit.ly/Is5Upd
From teachers to coaches: Who helped pave the way for you? Say "thank you" & tag them in the comments below. #KeepGoodGoing http://bit.ly/17jJMbI
25 ways to slow down & appreciate the holidays, via Wise Bread #StressFreeHoliday
Today is International Day of Persons with Disabilities. Join us in recognizing the achievements that people with disabilities make every day.
Sorry guys, God just did thorough investigation himself, and explained it was not your fault. I mean, it was not your fault either way, but you were not even giving him a hard time.
I have deleted my comment after this issue was cleared up with God's family. My apology.

Dear New York Insurance Company,
Our heavenly Father has spoken to his people and cleared up the misunderstanding. I have humbly deleted my previous threatening comments and wish to offer my sincere apologies.

I guess we have all learnt something here today, 'Thou shalt not be a cunt to thy neighbor'

Have a good day

I have removed my post and apologize for commenting without all the facts.  In this day and age of large financial companies taking advantage of customers, I acted in haste and prejudged New York Life Insurance. I also urge everyone else who jumped to the same conclusion to delete their posts. While we must stick together, we must also admit our mistakes.

I heard there were a lot of angry words posted to this page recently. Though I was not one of the posters, I know why they did it and I want to be among the first to apologize on their behalf. They only had half of the story and went off emotion. Now, having the full story, they should all realize that the harsh words were said out of turn and if they don't come and apologize, I'll do it for them. The person for which the harsh words were said, addressed the situation and corrected the mistake. So again, I am sorry for the misplaced anger that came from a group of people that thought they were doing good by being bad.
Sorry for jumping to conclusions. Was immature of me. I apologize sincerely.

I took down everything telling people not to do business with you. God told us what really happened. Honestly, he's to blame for this, too. He should know the type of power he has, what with his million+ fanbase. He should have been able to predict this. But anyway, sorry. I know everyone else is sorry, too.

Just read God's post explaining the circumstances that led to the non-payment of the life insurance after his mothers death.  I apologise for posting a negative statement on this, without true understanding of the facts.  A real shame, for her to cancel so close to her passing, and for it to add to her families worries.  Perhaps you could keep good going, and possibly add a tiny amount of your profits to God's crowdfund for his fathers future?  Or maybe even pass the link and a brief explanation onto your facebook or twitter followers?  I am sure if you look at God's page you will see clearly the good he keeps going, and the folk he helps :)  That would be nice of you...
Thanks for contacting God and clearing things up.
Looks like it was a more complicated issue than originally imagined. I personally apologize for any public relations damage caused and I appreciate your giving God the attention he deserved.

It never ceases to shock me how willing people are to launch into a mob mentality despite not being fully armed with the facts. I would urge everyone that is making public, libellous claims (fraud etc) that could do serious long term damage to this company to consider the possible consequences of their actions.  I wouldn't be surprised if there is already a list of names of people that have done so. You all only know one side of the story with no evidence that the version you have heard is true.
Why you keep taking Gods dads money if you no going to pay a claim?
1175361 people 'like' god. I guess many of us are potential customers. Hmmm, I'd pay up and review your policies if I were you. Power to the people!!
Get right with God or feel his wrath! You're about to have a holy war on your hands.

NEW YORK LIFE IS A COMPANY THAT DOES NOT CARE ABOUT PEOPLE. EVER SINCE I SIGNED UP WITH AARP AND FOUND THEY SHARE YOUR INFORMATION WITH EVERYBODY - I STARTED GETTING EVERY MONTH SOMETIMES MORE PROPOSALS FROM NEW YORK LIFE. I EACH TIME CALLED AND REQUESTED TO BE REMOVED FROM THE LIST. I WAS TOLD OK RIGHT AWAY OR OTHER TIMES TREATED POORLY AS I REQUEST TO BE TAKING OFF THE LIST. HOW EVER A YEAR LATER AND STILL 1 TO 2 TIMES A MONTH I GET THE JUNK MAIL PROPOSALS FROM NEW YORK LIFE AGAIN AND AGAIN THEY JUST DO NOT CARE - ALL THEY WANT IS TO MAKE YOU THINK THEY CARE AND THAT THEY ARE OFFERING GREAT PRICES - TRUTH BE TOLD THE PRICES THEY ARE CHARGING IS MUCH HIGHER THAN ANY GOOD SHOPPER WOULD PAY!!! BOTTOM LINE I WANT ALL JUNK EMAIL FROM YOUR COMPANY TO STOP!!!!
self employed

Do you know which Insurance Company insures the lives of New York Life employees?  If you guessed New York Life you'd be wrong.  The company that insures New York Life employees is UnumProvident because it provides the same coverage at far cheaper cost.  New York Life should change their company slogan to "The Company You Can't Afford".

It's a good thing that Jesus didn't have a New York Life insurance policy because his claim would have been denied with the company claiming that the death was caused by an act of God and not natural causes.
Wow, count me out as to ever being a customer.

its incredible how you dare to post suich loving and caring pictures and slogans on your page. but when someone passes for real you look for the first excuse to weasel your way out of paying out. you have no heart nor soul and I hope to be there when you rock up at heavens gates and #god smites you all back down to hell . you soulless greedy people!
hail to the king, hail to new life, hail to our great company.... the company that makes the difference clear..
Fastest way to get a ticket to (social media) hell: Deny an insurance payment to Gods dad. *smite*
Pay God you heartless bastards!
It's time to give thanks to 'God.

Hiya, I'm so sad to hear that as yet you haven't managed to reach an amicable settlement with 'God' and his Dad.  If you could sort this out ASAP it would be great as He would be able to concentrate on giving help and support to those that need Him.

p.s. He does this for free, and over one million people are grateful because in reality 'He is just one of us'

p.p.s. If you get some spare time, please watch "It's A Wonderful Life"
Thank you for your time spent reading this post
It's bad when Facebook Gods fans ruin your Facebook page. It gets worse when the media find out and have a field day. Please do the right thing. Even is atheists love Facebook God. Smite!
Pay God's dad or you are the Devil.
Smite!

Surely notifying somebody when they have missed two payments is a more reasonable policy position than the stance you seem to have taken against my friend. If you send out notification letters then people are able to rectify the problem. Also if the policy holder is extremely ill or dying then a payment may have slipped through the cracks. Sending out a notification of a missed payment will alert relatives and partners that there is an issue and thus the payment can be made. It really is just common sense and your refusal to pay out on an insurance policy because of a missed payment by a dying woman after a lifetime of paying your company for a service is just appalling. You should be ashamed
PAY GOD NOW!!!!!
Is it your policy to not pay if someone has missed 2 premium payments without first notifying the client that their insurance has been cancelled?   That's pretty low.
Pay god now!
Can you please be merciful and show compassion towards these people? God needs you to step up now!
Hullo! :p~~~~
Cut God some slack, guys. We know you're sharks, but how about you chew on someone else?
The company you lose!!!!  LMAO!!!!
New York Life cancelled my health insurance after 27 years !!!!!!  Way to go, New Your Life. Way to go.  You're a great company.  Won't ever be buying from you again.  It's off to Obamacare.
God needs your love

I think that you have seriously underestimated the people and the power of social media. I think the days are numbered for the uncontrolled greed that corporations like yours have enjoyed for so long, as humanity gathers together, and we share our experiences. And I think that we have found a new God, one of caring and laughter and honesty, who when we reach out, he responds in kind, and shows us that when one of us is harmed, we ALL are.  You have betrayed trust. You inflict insult upon injury. and you have broken the promise you made to be there to "insure" a loss.  We are not Anonymous, but we are legion, and we will not let you continue to suck us dry simply to gain "points" and keep your investors happy. Like Anonymous, we will not forget.

Really DON'T like your page/company/ethics/policies. From where I'm standing NYL looks like a stereotypical insurance company. Fleece the poor, line the shareholders pockets. So far, so normal. But to continue taking premiums when the policy is void due to missed payments is crossing a line. You denied the family the chance to get more life insurance (they thought they were still covered) and didn't tell them off the status of their policy. And merrily took their premiums every month. For years. Wow. That's a new kind of crappy service. And illegal. Theft, fraud? Not sure. I'm sure the lawyers with sort it out. Merry Christmas Jerks.
NYLIC have made contact with God! Praise the Lord!
Shame!
#newyorklifesucks - lets get this trending!!!!

I only "Liked" your page so I could keep closer watch to see if you do the right thing for God's family, and all families.  No one should have to suffer the loss of a loved one, and then suffer some more when their insurance company chooses to be greedy.
KEEP GOD GOING!!

If your company continued to accept payments on a policy even after voiding it, you still have to pay. 
I am SO glad that my husband's life insurance wasn't through your sham of a company. My daughter and I might be living in a cardboard box if it had been!

Wow. Real nice job there denying somebody 300k worth of life insurance because of 2 missed payments. You insurance companies always do this to the little guy, find a technicality in their policy and screw em in the end. I wonder how long they paid into that policy, how many payments weren't missed, how many people were going to depend on that policy once this lady passed. I'm a little young for life insurance but I know when I do get it. I'll do my best to avoid a scum company like this. Fortune 100 my ass.
Then I pray you do the loving thing. Xxx

This company's new slogan is "Keep Good Going".  The word "Good" is code for profits".  This companies spends more money on lobbying Congress to pass industry favorable legislation than humanitarian efforts of charity.
Show some compassion, especially at this time of the year. A family has lost a wife, a mother, a friend, and now they could lose their home? Have some mercy.
This wont stop until its resolved. People don't forget.

I actually stopped working at a job that I loved for so very long because they lost all professional integrity. And I have since refused to work for scrupulous businesses since. Alot of people tell me that my little protest doesn't matter, and that I'm living a life of poverty and odd jobs for no good reason. Well I can't live with myself anymore, knowing better and working with (or giving my business too) horrible people "Because I have to". If I don't have to put up with bad business, And if and when more people join me in the good fight, bad companies will either have to evolve or die. So say all of your customers found out about what you did, and how you're perfectly fine with scamming the elderly out of money and tossing them aside when they actually need you to uphold YOUR end of the contract... Say they found out... what then? Would you choose to evolve, or die? You WANTED this. This was YOUR choice.

We think it's important to stop and address the concerns posted on our Facebook page today. We are making efforts to learn more about the case and help resolve it. As always, if you have any questions about a policy, please email us at socialmedia@newyorklife.com.

your company strongearms & robs people without a pistol.
 will forever leave a bad stain in my memory.  how you could do that to a minister who has dedicated his life to others, who missed A FEW PAYMENTS.  did you work with him when he missed his few payments?  no, you kept taking his money knowing damn well you'd never deliver on your end. 
i hope your company crumbles.

Don't trust this company, read bellow, they denied to pay a policy for a family, this family skipped two payments long time ago but continued paying, this evil insurance company continued receiving payments knowing that they could use this two forgotten payments to avoid their responsibility, they could make the same on you when your family needs it, they will find ANY reason to avoid paying you.

wow!  look at all these people who care more about God's family than you blood sucking vampires care about honesty and integrity.  you do know there are so many of us that enjoy nothing better than taking constant little jabs at big bullying, greedy companies like you.  you think a little mosquito is nothing until there are thousands taking little bites out of you.  we're all just going to keep on biting you until you make it right for Gods's father.  maybe we can all suck the blood right out of the bloated monstrosity that you've become.

I reallg dislike this life insurance policy. After many many years of paying into it. If you become sick and in the hosptial and miss several payments, you do not get the life insurance! SO all those YEARS of laying money into this company for your life insurance and if you miss too many payments and die this company keeps EVERY DIME you sent them. You don't get a damn refund! THIS IS HOW THEYRE MAKING THEIR MONEY!!! Off of dying folk!

Please....show some integrity and honor God 's mother's life insurance policy. In these difficult financial times it is unimaginable that your company would keep the funds that have been paid until this point. Either return the money or honor the insurance pay off please. I guarantee that you will be better off financially as many more people, myself included, would sign up with your company. Thank you.

You may be legally entitled to deny a payout for 2 missed payments, but it sure makes you such lovely human beings ... NOT. If you continued to accept payments after voiding the policy, that makes you thieves.
For shame, New York Life Insurance Company. For shame.

I was shocked to read that you do not pay out life insurance if someone misses two payments. How dare you deny a retired minister,or anyone else for that matter,  his right to monetary safety based on that! I'd advise any customer pr any potential customer of yours to take this into consideration.

Family top of what list...to rip off...to hurt...to destroy...
Do not take out any form of insurance with these cheats, liars, home wreckers...a grieving elderly man who lost his wife, the rock of his family cannot pay his mortgage as two payments were missed on his wifes insurance which the company never mentioned had made the policy void...this company carried on without hesitation taking the monthly payments...and now, the elderly grieving husband and father cannot make the monthly payments on the mortgage.
Way to go!! Happy Thanksgiving :/
Scumbag NYLI, if you keep billing than you lose the right to void a policy! just evil
Seriously, you are lower than low if you continue to take installments from the insured and then renege on the policy because of a couple of missed payments. You will all go to hell for this one. God

If god’s parents missed two payments and you didn’t say anything, yet continued to take their money in bad faith, you are despicable.  Why don’t you just deduct the two payments from the policy payout if it’s that important.  I think the Pope has even been talking about your kind recently.  May God have mercy, but if he didn’t I wouldn’t blame him.
Beware:  Life Insurance Co's! Taking advantage of grieving families since the dawn o time! @NewYorkLife  #KeepGoodGoing #Thanksgiving

I am astonished.  How can you legally continue to take money from a family, knowing that when their policy comes due, you are going to deny their claim because of two payments missed in the past?  I hope they get a lawyer and sue you into oblivion.  

Oh and by the way,  I don't use you now and will never use your services in the future.  What you are doing is inhuman and you should be ashamed of yourselves.
This probably doesn't matter to you people seeing how helpful you were to God, but you guys suck! come out of your money hoarding caves for a bit and do what is right, you can count your spoils later
Warning, if you miss two payments with this company your policy is void.

If you guys really want to risk pissing off the almighty, there is no policy on Earth big enough to cover your asses. You don't need a senior exec from risk management to know what the smart move is here: pay out God's dad's policy. Every hour that passes is smoking your good will with the true believers. #KeepGoodGoing

If you continued to take policy payments after two missed payments than shame on you. Shame, shame, shame. You don't even begin to know the bad publicity you are going to get because while you may have teams of lawyers the little people sometimes get a voice too. Give God's dad his life insurance on his dead wife.
You ought to be ashamed of your behavior with God's father.  If you care to sell any insurance in the future, to anyone involved in social media (read:  everyone), consider paying out the policy.
Why not feature an ad with your new trademark: Miss two payments, your policy is void!

I don't believe in god 
So we cool. 
Rock on NYLI

"Hey we'll just deny this random family some money. No biggie."

Turns out to be an internet sensation with an incredible amount of influence. Sucks to suck, Shostabrovich.

You say  keep family at the top of your list yet u fail to pay out an elderly family man just because he missed two payment and the you still collected payments after you know the policy was void . Shame. this is so terrible and dishonest . Do the right thing you jerks !
You guys are the scum of the earth scamming God's dad out of his money over 2 missed payments. Mr CEO have fun in something I'd like to call HELL! -_-

Yep, taking money from someone after they've missed payments then denying them coverage because of said missed payments sounds like fraud to me.  You've really stepped in it here and I sincerely hope you make this right without it becoming a legal hassle for a grieving family.  Of course I'd still warn everyone I know away from doing business with you.  You should all be ashamed.

I really hope you pay out the life insurance policy for God's Mum. Pretty shameful that you refuse to based on two missed payments, yet you still collected further payments from them after they missed two of them. Terrible!

Do the right thing, give this man what he deserves in his time of need. Think of the awful PR this is for your company at the very least, and think of how much better off you'll be by just holding up your end of the agreement and paying this man what he is owed. It's the least you can do.
